review: I had an amazing time at the beach. my experience with alain was great. he made us feel welcomed, comfortable and kept up a good conversation.

Charlie and Alex from ninth Street were very helpful for the help me set up a Bird show me weather in jetskis and kayaking and water score were located I’m totally gonna be recommending this area to my friends with family thank you
This park was located across from our resort.It provides a relaxing spot to catch some shade and remove the sand from your body. There is also a public restroom if you need it
Had a great time on the beach with a very nice umbrella and chairs provided by noah. Noah service was great and would recommend him if you are looking for a great time at the beach
It is so nice having this visually and as an option for the sand or street. Good planning.the park is right across from the Art Deco district.
Noah was very helpful it was a wonderful experience coming to 7th street his assistant was amazing can’t wait to come back !
It was peaceful and clean here. Lovely views, clear water that was very warm and refreshing. The walk way around the park was also kept clean.
This park was great, lots of people just taking a stroll, rollerblading, skateboarding or working out. The park is right on South Beach which has beautiful water and sand.

Wonderful experience! Me and my friends rented a cabana this afternoon and Rasheed took great care of us! I will be back soon!
Had a wonderful time with my friends, we purchased a cabana and took great photos, 10/10 recommend! Rashied was a great help and staff member!
Beautiful trees but limited access due to hurricane damage. Would recommend going once the docking is back up so you can walk through the wetlands.
This place is so relaxing and safe you can watch the birds and all the beauty that mother nature offer.
Amazing forest...beautiful! Make sure you spend some time visiting the forest, you will enjoy the scenery.

What a surprise! I absolutely loved this place! It is beautiful with lots of trees, plants, iguanas, birds, turtles, etc.... There is a nice elevated waking bridge that takes you through the forest. It is a peaceful walk. The next time we come to this area, we will walk here again!!

This is a wonderland of nature! Beautifully maintained; well laid out with documents of what birds and wildlife you are viewing, {of hearing) and it keeps getting better. A delightful educational experience!
Nothing compares to the unique experience of walking in this ancient forest. Worth the trip to Palmas Del Mar as there are great restaurants there, too.
Check out the tree house and bring snacks for the kids. The walk on the trail (elevated wood walkway, not dirt) is nice and relaxing.

Very nice small forest. Very comfortable above the surface trails, no mosquitos, quiet, and cool. It has parking lot for cars and carts. We are always surprised that such park has a place in Palmas del Mar.

We did the short (1.6km) loop trail on our way through the park. It was a really interesting short walk along former railbeds, with interpretive panels explaining what we were seeing. Highly recommended.
We did the going to the sun road and enjoyed the scenery along the way. Only animals we came across were some mountain sheep. We only stopped once because all of the hiking points had no parking
We were here by the end of May. Due to the avalanche, a large area of Glacier National Park were closed. We stopped at some places to catch the beauty of the area and took some pictures.
This was my first time that I have been in Canada's Glacier National Park and it was awesome. I just hope that this will never be destroyed. One can wander around and admire the beauty of nature.
Drove up from kelowna and boy was it beautiful! Get your day pass at Roger's pass visitor center. Bring your bear bell and bear spray and enjoy
We spent three days here. First off, if you’re going hiking in early July, be sure to bring good, waterproof hiking boots

We went to the Rogers Pass Center and watched the bear video and talked to the ranger about bear encounters. Then we drove east no more than 2-3km through the snow tunnels when a grizzly climbed over the jersey barricade and went straight across the highway.
Canada's Glacier National Park is a spectacular cirque of peaks with wonderful, remote hiking trails. Do not miss this experience between Golden and Revelstoke on the Trans-Canada Highway!!
The Park was larger than I had imagined. It was a beautiful drive through the park and we made the one big stop on our list...Giant Cedar Boardwalk.
I visited the Glacier National Park of Canada in June 2018 and it was one of the absolute highlights of my trip. No struggle to find a parking space here like in some of the neighboring parks!
Lots of places to camp and hike ... The views of the mountains are amazing.. the colors in the fall in beautiful.. a must do..
The smelll of the forest and sound of the stream make this a very peaceful spot.Trails start here for adventures into the back country.
We hiked the Great Glacier trail and visited the Rogers Pass Discovery Centre. The hike allowed us to experience some fantastic views of the mountains and streams.
Glacier National Park is definitely worth visiting. There are a lot of hikes but most of them are quite difficult so make sure you are prepared.
We actually went through Glacier National Park twice on our trip. We must have missed the official entrance..

This park is one of a kind in that it’s very easy to experience the best of it without having to do any hiking or difficult climbs. Probably because of this, it’s a very popular and busy park. The easy and paved Rim trail in Grand Canyon Village and around Yavapai Point was packed with throngs of people when we were there, although it did calm down a lot early in the morning and at night.
We took a tour with Sweetwater Tours from Las Vegas to the Grand Canyon. Our host Sharron and Bernise the driver were fantastic.

This trip is a great one to do before you explore Vegas. Hi Sharon has a great knowledge of the history of Las Vegas and expertly explained everything about the city and the Grand Canyon whilst on our way.
Orange line shuttle bus driver Tom G. tried shutting the door on us because unbeknownst to us, we were getting in the wrong door.

Recently visited the Grand Canyon for the first time. It was a very impressive view and glad that I was able to cross it off my list. We visited on. Friday and got there late morning. The lines to get in the park weren’t too bad at that time of day (10:00 am) although I’ve heard and read that lines can get really backed up later in the day.

I have been the Grand Canyon twice. The first time I walked the South Rim from Mathers point until the day was over. I attempted the shuttle in the summer and it was packed. This time I went in April and splurged for ebikes..

The parking lot at the visitor center is massive and also fills up by 9am (and that was in March, I can't imagine what it's like in peak season). The visitor center was closed due to covid while we were there, so we couldn't go in sadly.
Long drive from Nevada and the colors at anytime of the day are amazing. If you stay till sunset you see so many amazing colors. Arizona’s landscape is one of the best.
What can one say. No words can describe what you are seeing. It blew our minds. Take your time and see how much even the same view changes with the light.
I leave a part of my heart in New York just to go back to get it later.
New York City is infuriating, agonizing, complicated, confusing, and overwhelming. And all of that makes it the greatest city in the world
I love the liveliness of the city as it is, I think that its diversity is one of its greatest attributes and makes New York City different from a lot of other cities across the United States.
THE BEST CITY IN THE WORLD! Growing up in New York City I have had the opportunity to explore so many different cultures, gain independence at a young age, and access so many different resources.
New York City, the anther view of America, I don't think there will be a place in America will look like New York,

A great landmark unfortunately the place was closed for filming so it was not in use but maybe without anyone you enjoy more the architecture and the stone/cement/material of the construction: shining grey lunar landscape.
This is an interesting place to visit. If you’re lucky you might see really awesome people practicing. If you’re not interested in skateboarding at all this is not a place to visit.

The place to watch skate boarders. If you like that, you can spend hours in this place! Wish I could skateboard as well, lol.
A real cool place to watch some seriously skilled boarders. Backdrop of the beach makes it visually awesome too.
We saw some really talented amateur skaters, can stand and watch for hours if you have the time. I am not really cool enough to hang out here ;)
When you are in Venice you must visit Venice Skatepark and feel the real spirit of Skateboard. Is incredible during the sunset.

Absolutely loved it. It was a beautiful day to jump!! Staff at the front desk were super nice and patient also crews who helped us to gear up (harness on) were amazing and helpful. And mostly tandem instructors Bo-Bo (Victor) and Rachel were just two thumbs up.

First time skydiving and it was awesome! Really great place to dive, with the location and the scenery of the area. Instructors are awesome, especially my instructor, Aaron. Great group of fun, enthusiastic and laid back people jumping out of planes all day and creating…
Not only was it one of the best feeling ever it was my daughters 9th bday makin it one of the best days of my life to remember. Great people. Cool video. Def a must try solo cant wait for that.
